subject: 730a 6/22 Update: Crew preps for entry
body:
730a 6/22 Update: Crew preps for entry



=================================

CBS NEWS STS-117 STATUS REPORT: 89
Posted: 7:25 AM, 6/22/07

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Analyst

Changes and additions:

   SR-87 (06/21/07): Re-entry delayed one day due to weather
   SR-88 (06/21/07): Updated deorbit timelines
   SR-89 (6/22/07): Astronauts gear up for entry

=================================

7:25 AM, 6/22/07, Update: Astronauts gear up for entry

The Atlantis astronauts are readying their spaceship for a weather-delayed landing today in either Florida or California. An overnight forecast continues to predict a chance of thunderstorms within 30 nautical miles of the Kennedy Space Center that could cause problems. But the forecast for the first two of three opportunities at Edwards Air Force Base, Calif., calls for windy but acceptable conditions. The winds are expected to build up as the day wears on, and forecasters believe the third and final California landing opportunity will be out of limits. The shuttle has enough supplies to stay in orbit until Sunday in a worst-case scenario.

The Spaceflight Meteorology Group at the Johnson Space Center in Houston plans to brief entry flight director Norm Knight around 9 a.m. An updated forecast will be posted here as soon as it is available. In the meantime, here is an updated list of all the day's landing opportunities (in EDT and mission elapsed time):


DAY...EDT..........DD...HH...MM...SS...EVENT

06/22/07
Fri  01:12:34 PM...13...17...34...30...KSC: Deorbit on rev 218
Fri  02:18:30 PM...13...18...40...26...KSC: Landing

Fri  02:43:39 PM...13...19...05...35...EDW: Deorbit on rev 219
Fri  03:49:54 PM...13...20...11...50...EDW: Landing

Fri  02:50:31 PM...13...19...12...27...KSC: Deorbit on rev 219
Fri  03:55:00 PM...13...20...16...56...KSC: Landing

Fri  04:18:38 PM...13...20...40...34...EDW: Deorbit on rev 220
Fri  05:23:44 PM...13...21...45...40...EDW: Landing

Fri  05:56:31 PM...13...22...18...27...EDW: Deorbit on rev 221
Fri  06:59:51 PM...13...23...21...47...EDW: Landing

Additional entry information is posted on NASA's STS-117 Landing Ground Tracks page:

http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/shuttle/shuttlemissions/sts117/main/landing.html

See the 11:12 p.m. status report for detailed entry timelines.
